intro: Acisanthera gracilis, commonly known as the slender sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters, featuring slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The flowers are usually pale blue to violet in color and bloom during the spring and early summer. It has small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. This plant is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
